title: Sorry this page not available
description: The content on our physician directory pages is only available to viewers in the United States. If you were looking for something else, please make sure that you entered the address of the page correctly and try again. You can also search MNT to find what you're looking for.
cleaned_text: This page is not available in your area. Status: 403 Message: Location restricted The content on our physician directory pages is only available to viewers in the United States. If you were looking for something else, please make sure that you entered the address of the page correctly and try again. You can also [search MNT](/search) to find what you're looking for. Thanks, The MNT Team Latest News New research has found that men who eat too few carbohydrates daily may shorten their lifespan, while the same is true for women who consume insufficient quantities of dietary fat. Is coconut oil healthy? A study found that it disrupted mice's ability to use leptin and insulin, two critical hormones, and as a result, may lead to diabetes and obesity. Researchers say a hormone known as irisin may be enhanced by exercise and can help with plaques and tangles that develop in the brain of people with Alzheimer's disease [After treatment with semaglutide, people with newly diagnosed type 1 diabetes needed little or no insulin](https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/after-treatment-with-semaglutide-people-with-newly-diagnosed-type-1-diabetes-needed-little-or-no-insulin) In a small study with 10 participants, researchers report that semaglutides, which are sold under brand names such as Ozempic and Wegovy, shows promise as a treatment for type 1 diabetes that doesn't involve insulin Researchers say antipsychotic medications are being overprescribed to treat symptoms such as agitation in people with dementia Researchers say vaccines such as flu shots are not linked to flare-ups in people with multiple sclerosis Researchers say adults as well as children with atopic dermatitis, the most common form of eczema, have a higher risk of developing inflammatory bowel disease, a condition that include both Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis A recent study confirms that higher educational attainment is protective against Alzheimer's disease even in people who are genetically predisposed to it. A nanogel-based carrier delivering a thyroid hormone-mimicking drug directly to the liver successfully lowered cholesterol levels and reversed obesity in mice. In a study in mouse models of Alzheimer's disease, researchers found that a molecule dubbed 'A11' successfully targets a key driver of neuroinflammation, improving cognitive function in the rodents.
